title.narrative: Emergency food and agriculture production support for food insecure groups affected by unprecedented surge in food prices

description.narrative: Outputs • 1,280 MT of assorted seeds and fertilizers ( 400 MT wheat seeds, 80 MT lentils seeds, 400 MT DAP and 400 MT Urea fertilizer, and 8,000 sachets of vegetable seeds) distributed in a timely and targeted manner to 8,000 needy, vulnerable and food-insecure households providing post harvest food security for at least 12 months after harvest • Wheat support to 8 000 vulnerable, low income food-insecure households for a period of two months. Allowing optimal utilization of provided agricultural inputs. Each household will receive 100 kilograms wheat per month over a two months period, In total, 1,600 MT wheat will be distributed, • Extension materials prepared and technical assistance provided to all partners to ensure effective targeting of beneficiaries, best practices in crop production and efficient use of inputs provided to beneficiaries.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency food and agriculture production support for food insecure groups affected by unprecedented surge in food prices

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
